item.content:encoded: Finally in print! The idea of writing a paper about the minimum wage was pretty scary. I'm glad we did. We learned a lot. We hope you do too! The appendix and replication package, including tex files is on my website. Thanks to @ChadJonesEcon, who was an excellent editor.
item.author: Simon Mongey

item.content:encoded: Someone should explain to Trump that cartels seek to *reduce* output, which supports higher (monopoly) prices.
item.author: Hal Singer

item.content:encoded: some notes from Meta's follow-up call
item.author: Mostly Borrowed Ideas

item.content:encoded: Andreessen on Fridman confirming the hyperscalers' are roundtripping revenue back to them via the AI investments. This is inching towards to Enron-like SPEs, where loss-making non-economic activity gets profits booked at $MSFT $GOOG $AMZN while the losses are the startups'.
item.author: Oh Come On!

item.content:encoded: Post COVID performance of alt managers. $BX growth was ‚Äúmore baked in‚Äù than $KKR and $APO. $CG constrained by fumbled succession plan and slow adoption of private wealth channel.

item.content:encoded: I knew a generational leadership shift was occurring when we had a WH press sec. named "Josh." Now a new rubicon has been crossed with a Sec of Defense with visible arm tattoos.
item.author: Hunter üåÜ

item.content:encoded: In a large US sample, approximately half of all women discontinue antidepressant usage during pregnancy (no change in usage for spouses). This is in a new paper that I just published with @claireeboone and @ccolina_pe that is primarily descriptive.
item.author: Devin Pope

item.content:encoded: Nice to see that $MSFT continues to spend $18B/yr "buying back" stock to *not* decreased the share count; instead s/o ROSE. If 20% of its income is out the door with zero benefit to shareholders, only to, employees as of last Q that's SALARY EXPENSE. It's true margin is sub 30%

item.content:encoded: Amazon will be cutting its volume to UPS by 50% by H2 2026: $UPS: -15% Pre-Market $AMZN

item.content:encoded: The pandemic fooled people for a while, but UPS turned back into a pumpkin soon enough

item.content:encoded: NY Times business reporters are not allowed to attribute any of Tesla's woes to the reactionary views of its CEO, which offend its liberal base of customers. Declining market shares can be explained entirely by "increased competition and Tesla's relative lack of new models."

item.content:encoded: je l'ai deja dit, mais il semble qu'il faille le repeter... Un impot "exceptionel" n'est d'aucune utilite si le probleme est un deficit primaire a moyen terme. Ca ne change rien au probleme a moyen terme, et ca envoie le signal que le gouvernement n'est pas serieux.

item.content:encoded:
$TMO reaction just screams out that life sci investors have reached a point of "dude just prove to me the EPS can actually grow"... rev below/EPS above was enough.
Tone on call seemed pretty good, especially if you compare it to the appearances they made late last year.

item.content:encoded: For all the hand wringing, AI may end up being so cheap that software vendors don't need to charge consumption based pricing
